text.section:
At the time of appointment, the Adjutant General shall:
have at least 2 years of commissioned field grade service in the National Guard;
have attained at least the rank of colonel; and
meet the requirements for federal recognition at the rank of Major General.
The Adjutant General is a member of the Governor's Executive Council.

If the Adjutant General is ordered into the active military service of the United States, the Governor may designate an acting Adjutant General to exercise the duties of the Adjutant General during the period the Adjutant General is on active military service.
